properties.MicroMemory Description: In the newsroom of NYUAD's student-run, independent newspaper The Gazelle, weekly issues are published each Saturday evening. Former Chief Editor Laura Assanmal, from her joint interview with Kaashif Hajee, shares how as writers complete their pieces and stand up to leave for the night, a team tradition is to serve them a round of applause.
Faculty Fellows in Residence Matteo Marciano and Adela Kovarova remember fondly the various special events they've organized with students, especially "Cultural Nights" and Emirati Cooking.

NYUAD Class of 2021 senior YunKai "Jonathan" Lee, in his interview with friend and classmate Nurpeiis Baimukan, talks about the development of their EdTech startup "Jagged," a mentorship "swipe to match" app that pairs high school students with students currently studying at their dream college to seek advice on student life, academics, and more. Here, Lee recalls a special moment under the palms.

properties.story title: Summer Rush: from Mussafah to Saadiyat Campus
properties.MicroMemory Description: Philip Panicker,  NYUAD'S Engineering Academic Laboratories Coordinator, remembers the busy summer of 2014 and shares his experience moving offices, instruments and lab equipment from the CSE building in Mussafah to their new homes on the Saadiyat campus.

properties.story title: The Nook: A Space between counsellor and friend
properties.MicroMemory Description: REACH stands for "Raising Empowered Advocates for Community Health." NYUAD Alumna Nadeen Alalami recalls the development of The Nook, a space REACH developed to help every student feel safe and supported.
NYUAD Arts Center Executive Director Bill Bragin shares an example of synergies created through one of the Center's valued traditions: community meals.

properties.story title: Unofficial Student Hub: The Equipment Center
properties.MicroMemory Description: Inside C3, just past the entrance, is the Equipment Center. Arts faculty Amos Katz, one-time Equipment Center manager during the "DTC days," reflects on the spirit and vibe of what he considers one of NYU Abu Dhabi's unofficial student hubs.
NYUAD Class of 2015 Alumna Krushika Patankar reflects on the community created between students and the dining hall staff, and how during her time at NYUAD, the relationship resembled a family.

The origin story of the NYUAD Plastic Lab includes a student-driven quest to build a low-cost plastic recycling machine. Plastic Lab Founding Director and former NYUAD Faculty member Felix Beck talks about the Lab. He shares its origin story, its purpose, and the vision to contribute to NYU Abu Dhabi's commitment to environmental responsibility -- including a memory of a junkyard visit so students could source materials to build a zero-waste recycling machine.
